poem:
**Whispers of the Atlantic**

America's breath  
draws shadows  
over green fields.  
The sea, a stubborn barrier,  
guards fragile hopes.  
The men in suits speak  
of meteors and markets;  
yet, beyond their words,  
an old land waits,  
holding its peace  
in the valley of the seasons,  
weathering storms  
without fear of stars.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump will not be ‘meteor’ blow to Irish economy, says employers’ group Donald Trump will not be a knockout “meteor” to Ireland’s economy despite its heavy reliance on US multinationals, the head of the country’s business trade organisation has said. While the US president told world leaders gathered at Davos last week that “Europe treats us very, very unfairly” there is a heightened sense of nervousness in Ireland that this could translate to an attempt". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
